rComments: Greta Hutchison is a terrible person. She's impatient, rude, says harsh things to students, incapable to be a teacher. Her lectures are boring and she never prepares for lectures. She's unclear, confusing and unapproachable. and her exams aren't relevant to what she teaches in class.

Okay here's the thing; it's not that she's a bad teacher, but she is extremely impatient, not understanding at all, and unrealistically demanding. She assigns more hw than all the other teachers, and she isn't very nice. Although I guess that it helps you improve faster, it's too stressful. I would never recommend her class to anyone.

Greta is so adorable! I love French so it was so lovely to have such a caring teacher. The only thing I didn't like about this class was iLrn- the online homework site. It was designed super poorly... Anyways Greta herself is a wonderful teacher and I would take another class of hers in a heartbeat!

Decent French professor. She got impatient with us often, even though most of us had never taken French before. Make sure to get to class on time and not leave even to go to the bathroom, and be prepared to feel embarrassed because its true she puts you on the spot frequently, making you look and feel stupid in front of everyone.

French 1 with Greta was a wonderful experience! She's sweet, funny, and easy to get along with (but don't be late, she will call you out). She made the class FUN, which language classes should be. FAR BETTER THAN ANGELA.

Greta is the best french teacher I have ever had. She is very helpful, has a great sense of humor and cares about her students and what she teaches. I looked forward to her class every day! Reading "La Vie Devant Soi" was the best part of the class. What a great experience, I highly recommend taking her class.

My worst experience in a Language Class. Her tests were very difficult. She likes to put people on the spot. She humiliated me in front of the class for not speaking fast enough and asked the class to help me out somehow...it was only french 1.

Greta could care less about her students!! She is mean, and rude and not helpfull at all when you ask for help. If you struggle at all she will just make you look and feel like an idiot. I have never had such a bad experience with a professor before. She changes her due dates and test dates all the time and then makes rude remarks for asking.
Overall an alright instructor, however class was a bit dry and boring.
Greta is awesome

She is much more difficult than my french professors in the past, but she spends a lot of time on pronunciation of even the simplest words, which I found to be refreshing. She emails homework out after class, and deciphering them is a bit difficult. She's somewhat unclear in her instructions, but if you pay attention, you can do it. She is adorable

had her before, she was a LOT different. the due dates or the content of hmwks, tests weren't clear at all. however, she did make an effort towards the end. she's also really strict on attendance and tardiness (she'll call you out in front of the class if you walk in late, or if you miss the prior class). she does have sweet moments though.

She's so sweet, and she genuinely cares about her student's well being in the class. Very engaging and passionate about French, I'm looking forward to taking French 5 next quarter with her. Highly recommended.
Greta is one of the best French teachers I've ever had. She actually cares about her students, and will make a point to personally help struggling students outside of class.
Greta is an awesome teacher! She is very clear, helpful, enthusiastic, and nice. I had a great French 1 experience.

Awesome class! Best class that I have had at UCSC! Greta is so nice and so helpful! You do have to work very hard in the class because there is lots of homework that you have to take alot of time on and the tests require alot of studying and are focused on detail. But everything is completely do-able if you put in the time. My french improved so mu

Greta is simply wonderful! I have had numerous french teachers, and so far she's the best one. Greta is so helpful and make you feel so comfortable, even when you make mistakes. She's patient and ALWAYS willing to help students in any way she can. She's the best French instructor we have at UCSC! I wish she could teach ALL the levels of French here
Greta is an old hag!  She treated us like we were in grade school...she seemed to have a huge chip on her shoulder.  She is my least favorite teacher that I had at UCSC.

Greta was a great language teacher. She is amazingly nice, one of the nicest people I've ever met, which is even more shocking because she is a language teacher. As far as the class went, it was great. I felt completely confortable in her classes and she is excellent at what she does. I didn't learn as much as I could in this class, but it was my 4
Greta is amazing.  She is very quick and knowledgeable. She can always find numerous examples to explain a concept so it's as easy as possible to understand.  Highly Recommended.
Greta was extremely helpful to me.  She always answered any questions i had and replied to emails regularly.  I really enjoyed being in her class. and she's super sweet!

greta is an amazing teacher. she honestly cares about each of her students and is always available for help when needed. her open and friendly attitude makes it easy to speak with her both on an individual basis as well as in classes. she is by far my favorite teacher of any i have had in this schoo

A petite swiss chorus singer. Her attitude matches that description-sweet and cute! She is so helpful and nice and since she's not itimidating you feel confident about speaking in class. I have had 3 other french teachers and she's the best I had. she likes to be there and it shows!
Greta is your ideal prof. Although she makes you study hard. Two thumbs up.

Greta is a really friendly person.  She is very wiling to help.  I think she gets frustrated with the class easily sometimes (like at the end of the quater when everyone is in the "i hate school" mode).  But her tests are fairly easy, but you do have to study for them.  Lots of written homework.
